intro: Thalictrum amphibolum, commonly known as the water avens, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It produces delicate, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. It is part of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy and often toxic members. Thalictrum amphibolum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for aquatic insects and small vertebrates.
